page.title: 10HARVESTING CHANGES
page.content: The biggest change which people have noticed since 1945 has been increasing mechanisation and reduced numbers of farm labourers. Until the end of the last war teams of men were employed for the harvest. Everyone available including wives had to help with stacking{STOOKS.}It once took a fortnight to harvest a field. Now, with{COMBINE HARVESTERS}it only takes a day. During the war horses were replaced by tractors. This saved time on the farm because horses needed a two-hour rest. Now only an hour's break is needed. Farmers' wives had to take 'pieces' (sandwiches) to men who were harvesting and provide meals for large numbers especially when the threshing mill came. Today she only has to cook for her own family.
